title: How to Store Blueberries
description:
Learn how to store blueberries with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Store-Blueberries

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to store blueberries start by making sure they're fully dry so that mold doesn't grow on them in storage then line a well-ventilated container like the plastic container they came in with a paper towel which will help absorb any moisture on the blueberries put the blueberries in the container and store them in the fridge for 5 to 10 days for long-term storage spread the blueberries out on a lined baking sheet freeze them for 3 hours and then transfer them to a freezer bag store the blueberries in the freezer for up to a yearto store blueberries start by making sure they're fully dry so that mold doesn't grow on them in storage then line a well-ventilated container like the plastic container they came in with a paper towel which will help absorb any moisture on the blueberries put the blueberries in the container and store them in the fridge for 5 to 10 days for long-term storage spread the blueberries out on a lined baking sheet freeze them for 3 hours and then transfer them to a freezer bag store the blueberries in the freezer for up to a year

title: How to Cook Acorn Squash
description:
Learn How to Cook Acorn Squash with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Acorn-Squash

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to cook squash first rinse the squash under cool running water and Pat it dry then cut off the ends and discard them slice the rest of the squash into rings and season the rings with salt and pepper to roast the squash pre-heat your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit or 205 degrees Celsius place the squash in a roasting pan then drizzle with olive oil put the squash in the oven and let it cook for 25 to 35 minutes it's done when it's easy to pierce with a fork season it more if you'd like and enjoy to saute the squash heat a skillet over medium-high heat add 2 to 3 tablespoons 30 to 45 milliliters of olive oil then add the squash to the skillet saute the squash until it begins browning and caramelizing remove the squash let it cool and enjoyto cook squash first rinse the squash under cool running water and Pat it dry then cut off the ends and discard them slice the rest of the squash into rings and season the rings with salt and pepper to roast the squash pre-heat your oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit or 205 degrees Celsius place the squash in a roasting pan then drizzle with olive oil put the squash in the oven and let it cook for 25 to 35 minutes it's done when it's easy to pierce with a fork season it more if you'd like and enjoy to saute the squash heat a skillet over medium-high heat add 2 to 3 tablespoons 30 to 45 milliliters of olive oil then add the squash to the skillet saute the squash until it begins browning and caramelizing remove the squash let it cool and enjoy

title: How to Cook Artichokes in the Oven
description:
Learn How to Cook Artichokes in the Oven with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Artichokes-in-the-Oven

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: before cooking your artichokes in the oven pre-heat your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit or 218 degrees Celsius next rinse the artichokes and trim off the stems carefully separate the leaves of the artichokes without snapping them off if you like seasoned them with lemon olive oil garlic butter or minced herbs wrap each artichoke in tin foil and bake them for one hour after an hour use a baking mitt or dry cloth to open one of the artichokes from its tin foil if the leaf separates easily from the center the artichoke is cooked enjoybefore cooking your artichokes in the oven pre-heat your oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit or 218 degrees Celsius next rinse the artichokes and trim off the stems carefully separate the leaves of the artichokes without snapping them off if you like seasoned them with lemon olive oil garlic butter or minced herbs wrap each artichoke in tin foil and bake them for one hour after an hour use a baking mitt or dry cloth to open one of the artichokes from its tin foil if the leaf separates easily from the center the artichoke is cooked enjoy

description:

subtitles: to cook brown rice first soak the rice in a bowl of water for 15 minutes soaking the rice first will help it cook faster next add two cups 250 millilitres of water for every one cup of rice to a pot and bring it to a boil add a pinch of salt to enhance the flavour of the rice scoop the rice into the pot of boiling water with a spoon then wait for the water to come to a rolling boil again now reduce the heat to medium and let the rice simmer uncovered for 15 minutes or until its chewy and tender during the rice in a colander and enjoy toto cook brown rice first soak the rice in a bowl of water for 15 minutes soaking the rice first will help it cook faster next add two cups 250 millilitres of water for every one cup of rice to a pot and bring it to a boil add a pinch of salt to enhance the flavour of the rice scoop the rice into the pot of boiling water with a spoon then wait for the water to come to a rolling boil again now reduce the heat to medium and let the rice simmer uncovered for 15 minutes or until its chewy and tender during the rice in a colander and enjoy to

subtitles: to cook cabbage peel off the cabbages tough outer leaves and cut the stem off with a knife cut the cabbage into quarters if you'll be boiling it to boil the cabbage submerge the quarters in the boiling water and cook them for two minutes next cover the pot and let it boil for an additional six to eight minutes if you're sauteing the cabbage cut it into strips next heat some oil in a pan over medium-high heat saute the cabbage in the pan for four to six minutes and serveto cook cabbage peel off the cabbages tough outer leaves and cut the stem off with a knife cut the cabbage into quarters if you'll be boiling it to boil the cabbage submerge the quarters in the boiling water and cook them for two minutes next cover the pot and let it boil for an additional six to eight minutes if you're sauteing the cabbage cut it into strips next heat some oil in a pan over medium-high heat saute the cabbage in the pan for four to six minutes and serve

description:

subtitles: before you cook green beans first cut or snap off the stems then put the beans in a coal under and rinse them with cold water if you want to keep your beans crispy blanch them by cooking them in a pot of boiling water for four to five minutes then soak the beans in a bowl of ice water for five minutes if you'd rather steam the beans place a steamer over a pan of boiling water put the beans in and cover the pan with a lid steam the beans for three to five minutes and enjoybefore you cook green beans first cut or snap off the stems then put the beans in a coal under and rinse them with cold water if you want to keep your beans crispy blanch them by cooking them in a pot of boiling water for four to five minutes then soak the beans in a bowl of ice water for five minutes if you'd rather steam the beans place a steamer over a pan of boiling water put the beans in and cover the pan with a lid steam the beans for three to five minutes and enjoy

title: Flax Seed
description: Flax Seed is an easy way to add nutrition to your meals. Flax Seed is solid source of calcium, protein, iron and fiber. Its also high in Omega 3. Syndicated columnist Rita Heikenfeld shows how to add flax seed in to your diet. Featuring Rita Heikenfeld from AboutEating.com.
subtitles: flax is a solid source of calcium iron protein and fiber plus it's considered a weak generally safe source of plant estrogen flax is good for your skin hair nails eyes and kidneys and flax is a great plant source of omega-3s but here's the kicker you have to eat the flax seeds ground up to absorb the nutrients otherwise all you're getting is fiber now you can buy flax already ground and it's sometimes called flax seed meal sprinkle flax on cereals and salads and pour some flax oil into your morning smoothieflax is a solid source of calcium iron protein and fiber plus it's considered a weak generally safe source of plant estrogen flax is good for your skin hair nails eyes and kidneys and flax is a great plant source of omega-3s but here's the kicker you have to eat the flax seeds ground up to absorb the nutrients otherwise all you're getting is fiber now you can buy flax already ground and it's sometimes called flax seed meal sprinkle flax on cereals and salads and pour some flax oil into your morning smoothie

subtitles: one washer potato to remove excess dirt to prick holes in the potato sides so steam can escape 3 season the potato with olive oil salt and pepper to taste 4 place the potato on a microwave-safe plate 5 cook the potato on high for 8 to 12 minutes 6 remove the potato once it's slightly firm but can be easily pierced with a fork 7 let the potato rest for 5 minutes before serving check the description below for more information including the full articleone washer potato to remove excess dirt to prick holes in the potato sides so steam can escape 3 season the potato with olive oil salt and pepper to taste 4 place the potato on a microwave-safe plate 5 cook the potato on high for 8 to 12 minutes 6 remove the potato once it's slightly firm but can be easily pierced with a fork 7 let the potato rest for 5 minutes before serving check the description below for more information including the full article

title: How to Boil Sweet Potatoes
description:
Learn How to Boil Sweet Potatoes with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Boil-Sweet-Potatoes

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to boil sweet potatoes first peel the skin off the potatoes using a vegetable peeler or paring knife then cut the potatoes into bite sized cubes bring a pot of water to a boil then add the sweet potatoes to it cover the pan and let the sweet potatoes cook for 10 to 30 minutes the longer you let them cook the more tender they'll be for added nutrients leave the skin on when you boil sweet potatoes you can also cut sweet potatoes into halves instead of cubes and boil them that way for 30 to 45 minutesto boil sweet potatoes first peel the skin off the potatoes using a vegetable peeler or paring knife then cut the potatoes into bite sized cubes bring a pot of water to a boil then add the sweet potatoes to it cover the pan and let the sweet potatoes cook for 10 to 30 minutes the longer you let them cook the more tender they'll be for added nutrients leave the skin on when you boil sweet potatoes you can also cut sweet potatoes into halves instead of cubes and boil them that way for 30 to 45 minutes

title: How to Cook Bacon in the Microwave
description:
Learn how to cook bacon in the microwave with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Bacon-in-the-Microwave

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to cook bacon in the microwave first line a microwave safe plate with a few paper towels spread the bacon out on top of the paper towels so none of the strips are overlapping then place a couple more paper towels on top of the bacon to catch any grease splatter microwave the bacon on high for 30 seconds per slice be sure to check to see if the bacon is finished cooking if it's not continue microwaving it in 30 second intervals until it reaches your preferred level of doneness when it's done let the bacon cool for one minute then gently blot it with a paper towel to remove any excess greaseto cook bacon in the microwave first line a microwave safe plate with a few paper towels spread the bacon out on top of the paper towels so none of the strips are overlapping then place a couple more paper towels on top of the bacon to catch any grease splatter microwave the bacon on high for 30 seconds per slice be sure to check to see if the bacon is finished cooking if it's not continue microwaving it in 30 second intervals until it reaches your preferred level of doneness when it's done let the bacon cool for one minute then gently blot it with a paper towel to remove any excess grease

description:

subtitles: to boil beetroot cut off the ends and boil the beetroot for 45 minutes to one hour if you want to roast beet fruit cut off the ends and cover the beetroot on a baking sheet with aluminum foil roast the beetroot at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 35 minutes with the foil on and 20 minutes with the foil off you can also steam beetroot by cutting it into quarters and cooking it in a steamer for 15 to 30 minutes until it's tender however you cook the beetroot season it with salt pepper olive oil or fresh herbs before servingto boil beetroot cut off the ends and boil the beetroot for 45 minutes to one hour if you want to roast beet fruit cut off the ends and cover the beetroot on a baking sheet with aluminum foil roast the beetroot at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 35 minutes with the foil on and 20 minutes with the foil off you can also steam beetroot by cutting it into quarters and cooking it in a steamer for 15 to 30 minutes until it's tender however you cook the beetroot season it with salt pepper olive oil or fresh herbs before serving
